page.title: 02TRANSPORT -NEW EXPRESSWAY.
page.content: Work on improving the A55 continues.In June 1985 a dual carriageway bi-passing Colwyn Bay was opened as far as Glan Conwy corner.At the moment a new link road is being constructed from the latter to Llandudno via Bodysgallen and Llanrhos.The next stage of the scheme is scheduled to start soon from Conwy Morfa towards Llanfairfechan.The final stage is crossing the River Conwy.The present plan is to sink a "tunnel tube" in the bed of the river.We have witnessed drilling rigs on the river during the year.Traffic queues at Conwy frustrate the locals and tourists in summer,yet incomprehensibly bi-passing the town is the last stage.Until the tunnel is completed the queues will remain and lengthen as the improved roads on either side of the bottleneck add to the traffic load.
